snippet: A damning report on the hacking scandal at Rupert Murdoch’s British papers convulsed the political and media worlds in Britain and threatens a core asset of News Corporation.
abstract: British parliamentary report on the hacking scandal at Rupert Murdoch's British newspapers concludes that he is not fit to run a huge international company; finds that three senior Murdoch executives misled Parliament in testimony; also says that the company sought to cover up widespread phone hacking at News of the World and offers new details that suggest further damaging revelations may lie ahead.

byline.original: By JOHN F. BURNS and RAVI SOMAIYA
byline.contributor: Sarah Lyall and Allen Cowell contributed reporting from London, and Amy Chozick from New York.

lead_paragraph: A damning report on the hacking scandal at Rupert Murdoch’s British papers convulsed the political and media worlds in Britain and threatens a core asset of News Corporation.

headline.seo: British Panel Criticizes Rupert Murdoch Over Hacking Scandal
headline.main: Panel in Hacking Case Finds Murdoch Unfit as News Titan
headline.print_headline: Panel in Hacking Case Finds Murdoch Unfit as News Titan
headline.sub: Parliamentary Panel Split on Party Lines Over Assessment

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
